claim: On April 29, 2018, a portion of the NH-74 highway near Rudrapur in Uttarakhand collapsed due to heavy rain, killing 2 people and injuring several others traveling in a bus that fell into the gorge as a result.

evidence.query: What Uttarakhand city is near the site where a portion of NH-74 collapsed due to heavy rain on April 29, 2018?
evidence.evidence: A part of a bridge over the Dhela river on Kunda to Rudrapur four-lane national highway (NH-74) collapsed due to the incessant rain and the release of water from the Tumaria Dam. The Ratanpur bridge in Kotdwar collapsed after heavy showers on Tuesday, and several residents had to be evacuated. The KotdwarPauri NH was also damaged at about 12 locations. About the Author Kautilya Singh A Senior Assistant Editor in TOI with an inclination towards political reporting.

evidence.query: What caused the collapse of a portion of NH-74 near Rudrapur in Uttarakhand on April 29, 2018?
evidence.evidence: However, NHAI later proposed the construction of the Rudrapur bypass. Gupta said that the bypass will connect NH-74 at Radha Swami Satsang Bhawan in Shimla Pistaur on Kichha road to villages in Rampur district, and the four-lane road will be constructed through Bhagwanpur located on Kashipur road. The road will further connect to the Pantnagar industrial area and thus, the vehicles will not have to come inside the city, leading to further congestion reduction. Meenu, the Project Manager at NHAI said that the compensation for the acquired land will be given to the affected people.

edited_claim: On April 29, 2018, a portion of the NH-74 highway near Rudrapur in Uttarakhand collapsed due to heavy rain, killing 2 people and injuring several others traveling in a bus that fell into the gorge as a result. This collapse occurred before the proposed construction of the Rudrapur bypass, which aimed to connect NH-74 at Radha Swami Satsang Bhawan in Shimla Pistaur on Kichha road to villages in Rampur district and further connect to the Pantnagar industrial area, reducing congestion in Rudrapur city.

evidence.evidence: It is noteworthy to mention here that HAL airport is the only airport in the country which is used for both prototype and developmental test flying and civil traffic. In the late 1990’s, the airport began providing its very first international service and became known as “Bangalore International Airport”. Ever since the airport had been established, it has undergone many expansions and upgrades to keep up with the rising air traffic in the city. HAL airport was handling Domestic and International flights up to 360 Aircraft Movements per day till May 2008 at a super saturated level of 10.2 million passengers per year.

evidence.evidence: About Kempegowda International Airport Bangalore Airport Location Kempegowda International Airport (IATA: BLR, ICAO: VOBL) (commonly known as Bangalore Airport) is an international airport serving the Indian city of Bangalore. It is located at Devanahalli about 30 kilometres (19 mi) from the Bangalore City Railway Station and covers 4,700 acres (1,900 ha). In 2008, it replaced the old HAL airport as the main commercial airport serving Bangalore. The airport earlier known as Bangalore International Airport was renamed after Kempe Gowda I, the founder of Bangalore in 2013.

edited_claim: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited Airport, also known as HAL Airport, is a general aviation airport for light aircraft located in Bangalore, Karnataka, which serves non-scheduled civilian traffic, including general, business, and VIP aviation. It was opened in 1941 and owned by Hindustan Aeronautics Limited, operating 24/7 with one runway. The airport, located about 12 km east of the city center, was used for both prototype and developmental test flying, as well as public passenger services until 2008 when those services ceased and Kempegowda International Airport took over as the primary commercial airport serving Bangalore.

claim: Tata Motors is an Indian multinational automobile manufacturer headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. It was founded by Jamsetji Tata in 1945 and was incorporated as Tata Engineering and Locomotive Company (TELCO) before being renamed Tata Motors in 2003.

evidence.query: What is the name of the Indian multinational automobile manufacturer headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra?
evidence.evidence: Tata Motors Limited is an Indian multinational automotive company, headquartered in Mumbai and part of the Tata Group . The company produces cars , trucks , vans , and busses . [6] Subsidiaries include British Jaguar Land Rover and South Korean Tata Daewoo . Tata Motors has joint ventures with Hitachi ( Tata Hitachi Construction Machinery ) and Stellantis , which makes vehicle parts for Fiat Chrysler and Tata-branded vehicles.

evidence.query: When was Tata Motors founded by Jamsetji Tata in India?
evidence.evidence: In 1901 Jamsetji began organizing India’s first large-scale ironworks, and six years later these were incorporated as the Tata Iron and Steel Company (now Tata Steel). Jamsetji’s other commercial ventures included the Taj Mahal Palace, the first luxury hotel in India. After Jamsetji’s death in 1904, his family retained control of the Tata Group and built it into a global conglomerate that by the early 21st century included more than 100 companies. A noted philanthropist, Jamsetji established the J.N. Tata Endowment in 1892, which encouraged Indian students to pursue higher education .

evidence.query: Who was the founder of Tata Motors in India?
evidence.evidence: FAQ: When was Tata Motors Founded? Tata Motors was founded in 1945 by Jehangir Ratanji Dadabhoy Tata Tata Motors Origin Country? India Who is Tata Motors Founder? J. R. D. Tata In which Year Tata Motors established?

edited_claim: Tata Motors is an Indian multinational automobile manufacturer headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. It was founded by Jamsetji Tata as Tata Engineering and Locomotive Company (TELCO) in 1945 and was renamed Tata Motors in 2003. They enchant the forest ghosts with their music, who promise to bestow magical powers upon them.

Full Form of INR – Conclusion The Indian Rupee (INR), with its full form as Indian National Rupee, holds a significant place in the history, economy, and culture of India. Its evolution from ancient silver coins to the modern currency system reflects the country’s diverse heritage and economic development.

evidence.query: What is the name of the official currency used in India for all financial transactions?
evidence.evidence: Indian Rupee in Global Trade The Indian rupee (INR) is the official currency of India and is used primarily in the country for domestic transactions. However, the Indian rupee is also used in international trade, particularly in trade with neighboring countries such as Nepal, Bhutan, and Bangladesh. In addition to this, the Indian rupee is also used as a reserve currency by some central banks around the world, including the Central Bank of Oman and the Bank of Russia. However, the Indian rupee is not a major currency in global trade and is not widely accepted in international transactions.

edited_claim: The rupee is the official currency of India, used throughout the country for all financial transactions, and plays a significant role in the Indian economy, including investment activities and capital markets. Its name comes from the Sanskrit word "rūpa" meaning "shaped" or "stamped", indicating its use as a currency with a standardized value. The rupee also holds a presence in international trade, particularly with neighboring countries and serves as a reserve currency for some central banks.

claim: Vaisakhi is the Indian New Year's national holiday celebrated in various parts of India, particularly in Punjab. Vaisakhi takes place on 13 or 14 April every year, depending on the lunisolar calendar, and marks the beginning of the new year in the Sikh community.

evidence.query: What is the name of the Indian national holiday celebrated in various parts of India, particularly in Punjab, that marks the beginning of the new year in the Sikh community?
evidence.evidence: The same day is also celebrated as Cheti Chand by the Sindhi community. Baisakhi – Sikh New Year: Source: Pinterest Baisakhi is celebrated with great enthusiasm in the North Indian state of Punjab. This harvest festival celebrated on the first day of the Vaisakh month (as per Punjab’s solar calendar) usually falls on the 13th or 14th of April. Baisakhi holds a special significance for Sikhs as this day coincides with the formation of Sikh Khalsa.

evidence.query: What is the significance of Vaisakhi in Punjab, India?
evidence.evidence: It reminds Sikhs of their important values. Significance of Baisakhi Baisakhi, also called Vaisakhi, is a big festival for Sikhs and Hindus in India and beyond. It happens every April 13 or 14 and marks the start of harvest time in Punjab, India. For Sikhs, Baisakhi is extra special because it remembers when Guru Gobind Singh Ji founded the Khalsa community in 1699 .

evidence.query: Which Indian community does Vaisakhi mark the beginning of the new year for?
evidence.evidence: Vaisakhi is celebrated by Hindu community and Indian & Nepalese diaspora in United States of America. Every year Nepalese Hindus gather up in traditional outsfits like kurtis and Nepalese caps to observe the Hindu Solar New Year. [116] The Bengali Hindu Community also celebrates its new year 'Pohela Baisakh' on this day. A Baisakhi Mela or fair is also held where Bengali handicrafts sessions are held.

edited_claim: Vaisakhi is a harvest festival celebrated on the 13th or 14th of April, depending on the lunisolar calendar, in various parts of India, particularly in Punjab. It marks the beginning of the new year for both Sikhs and Hindus, including the Sindhi community who celebrate it as Cheti Chand. The festival holds special significance for Sikhs as it commemorates the formation of the Sikh Khalsa in 1699. Vaisakhi is also celebrated by Hindu communities, including the Indian and Nepalese diaspora in the United States, and the Bengali Hindu community who observe their new year 'Pohela Baisakh' on this day.

claim: The Indian Premier League (IPL) Final is the annual championship match of the Indian Premier League, India's premier Twenty20 cricket league. It has served as the culmination of every IPL season since its inception in 2008.

evidence.query: What format of cricket does the Indian Premier League Final follow?
evidence.evidence: Finally, the end of the IPL will happen after this match. The grand final is played between the winners of Qualifier 1 and Qualifier 2. The team that conquers the final etches their name on the IPL title. Read

evidence.query: Which cricket league does the Indian Premier League Final serve as the culmination for in India?
evidence.evidence: The Chennai Super Kings have won the Indian Premier League for a record-equaling fifth time with a last-ball, five-wicket victory over the defending champion Gujarat Titans. Ravindra Jadeja plundered a six and a four from the last two deliveries against Mohit Sharma to help the Super Kings chase down a revised target of 171 runs in 15 overs. The IPL needed three days to complete the final. It was washed out on Sunday, started late Monday and finished after 1:30 a.m. local time on Tuesday.

edited_claim: The Indian Premier League (IPL) Final is the annual championship match of India's premier Twenty20 cricket league, the Indian Premier League, which has served as the culmination of every IPL season since its inception in 2008. The final is played between the winners of Qualifier 1 and Qualifier 2, and the conquering team etches their name on the IPL title. For instance, in 2023, the Chennai Super Kings won the IPL for a record-equaling fifth time by securing a last-ball, five-wicket victory over the defending champion Gujarat Titans in a final that was delayed and stretched over three days due to weather constraints.

claim: The Indian Premier League (IPL) is a professional Twenty20 cricket league in India, featuring eight teams, representing various cities across the country.

evidence.query: How many teams participate in the Indian Premier League (IPL) representing various cities across India?
evidence.evidence: [6] and currently consists of ten teams in ten cities across India . The inaugural IPL season was won by Rajasthan Royals . [10] As of May 2022 [update] , there have been fifteen seasons of the IPL tournament.

evidence.query: Which professional cricket league in India features the Twenty20 format?
evidence.evidence: Significant regional leagues include: Karnataka Premier League (2009–present) Tamil Nadu Premier League (2016–present) Saurashtra Premier League (2019–present) KCA President's Cup T20 (2020–present) Maharashtra Premier League (2023) UP T20 League (2023) Nepal Everest Premier League (2017–present) Sri Lanka SLC Twenty20 Tournament (2004–2018) SLC Super Provincial Twenty20 (2008–2016) Sri Lanka Premier League (2011–2012), franchise league Super 4's T20 (2014) SLC T20 League (2018) Ireland Inter-Provincial Trophy (2013–present) Women's Super Series (2015–present) Netherlands Dutch Twenty20 Cup (2007–present) Scotland Murgitroyd Twenty20 (2008–present) Regional Pro Series (2016)

edited_claim: The Indian Premier League (IPL) is a professional Twenty20 cricket league in India, featuring eight teams representing various cities across the country. As of May 2022, there have been fifteen seasons of the IPL tournament, with the inaugural season won by Rajasthan Royals. The league currently consists of ten teams in ten cities across India. There are also several significant regional leagues, including the Karnataka Premier League, Tamil Nadu Premier League, and Saurashtra Premier League, among others, in countries like Nepal, Sri Lanka, Ireland, and the Netherlands.

claim: Pongal is a four-day harvest festival celebrated in Tamil Nadu, India, dedicated to the Sun God and held during the Tamil month of Thai (mid-January to mid-February).

evidence.query: During which Tamil month does the Pongal festival take place in Tamil Nadu?
evidence.evidence: January is a special month as it opens the window to a new and fresh year. It is even more special for the people of Tamil Nadu as they welcome their harvest festival, Pongal. The four-day event that is dedicated to the Sun God marks the Sun’s journey northward, Uttarayan. Pongal is usually celebrated between 13 and 16 January.

edited_claim: Pongal is a four-day harvest festival celebrated in Tamil Nadu, India, dedicated to the Sun God and usually held between 13 and 16 January, marking the Sun's journey northward, Uttarayan, during the Tamil month of Thai (mid-January to mid-February).

claim: Thiruvathira refers to a festive event in the traditional Malayali culture of Kerala, celebrated on the day of the brightest star, Mrigasira, in the Dhanu rasi (Capricorn) constellation, which usually falls in mid-December or January, marking the beginning of the festive season.

evidence.query: What marks the beginning of the festive season in Kerala according to the traditional Malayali culture?
evidence.evidence: People create intricate and colourful flower arrangements called pookkalam (flower carpets) in front of their homes to welcome King Mahabali. (Image: Shutterstock) Malayalam New Year 2023: Chingam 1 marks the beginning of the harvest season in Kerala and is considered an auspicious day. This year it falls on August 17.

edited_claim: Thiruvathira refers to a festive event in the traditional Malayali culture of Kerala, celebrated on a day marked by the brightest star, Mrigasira, in the Dhanu rasi (Capricorn) constellation, which typically occurs in mid-December or January, and involves creating intricate flower arrangements called pookkalam (flower carpets) in front of homes to welcome King Mahabali. However, it does not mark the beginning of the harvest season or Malayalam New Year, which is Chingam 1, celebrated in mid-August.

claim: Ugadi is the New Year festival celebrated by the people of Andhra Pradesh, India, marking the beginning of a new Hindu lunisolar calendar year. It is observed with cultural festivities, special meals, and the exchange of well wishes.
edited_claim: Ugadi is the New Year festival celebrated by the people of Andhra Pradesh, India, marking the beginning of a new Hindu lunisolar calendar year. It is observed with cultural festivities, special meals, and the exchange of well wishes.
